title: Applying the given endpoints to the function
text: The first step would normally be to evaluate the function at the given endpoints, but these endpoints are non-inclusive so can't test them.

title: Finding the derivative
text: To find the critical points, we need to find the first derivative of the function.

title: Finding the critical point(s)
text: The critical point(s) are the values of $$x$$ which cause the first derivative of the function to be equal to zero within the given domain

title: Solve for the value(s) of $$x$$ that set the first derivative of the function to zero.
text: Solve for value(s) of $$x$$ in the following: $$0=\frac{-\left(1-2x\right)}{{\left(x-x^2\right)}^2}$$.

title: Finding the local and absolute maxima
text: The final step is to compare the resulting $$y$$ values from the critical values. The $$x$$ value with the highest corresponding $$y$$ value is the absolute maximum. The $$x$$ value with the lowest corresponding $$y$$ value is the absolute minimum. Any other continuous critical points can be local maxima with the same conditions holding true as for absolute maxima.
